intro: Brachyphragma braumonii, commonly known as the African violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features rosettes of velvety, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Brachyphragma braumonii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
